meanings.definition: To remove a swathe or bandage from
meanings.sent1: The nurse will unswathe the bandage from your arm.
meanings.sent2: After the surgery, the doctor will unswathe the wound carefully.
meanings.sent3: As the bandage unraveled, it revealed a colorful tattoo underneath.
meanings.sent4: She unswathed the mystery surrounding the hidden treasure map.
meanings.sent5: With a gentle tug, she unswathed the bandage, exposing the healed scar.

meanings.definition: To uncover or reveal by removing a covering
meanings.sent1: The magician will unswathe the cloth to reveal the hidden object.
meanings.sent2: Slowly unswathing the gift, she discovered a beautiful painting inside.
meanings.sent3: The surprise gift was unswathed to reveal a playful puppy inside.
meanings.sent4: As the fog lifted, it unswathed the majestic mountain in the distance.
meanings.sent5: With a dramatic flourish, he unswathed the curtain to unveil the new product.
